definition: the rules and discipline that apply within a family/stick used for punishing children or servants/traditions of an artistic or academic school of thought, passed on from master to pupil

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Your method is against the domestic disciplines made by our forefathers.
sentences.chinese: 你的这种做法是有悖于祖宗家法的。

sentences.english: MeiYiHe answer the four great uncles please, MeiXianZu escaped the family the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 梅乙鹤应允了四叔公之请，梅贤祖逃过了家法这一劫。

definition: beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
variant of 訓誡|训诫[xun4 jie4]
the law/the law of the land/the law of a state (in former times)/criterion
to suffer beating/fig. to be severely criticized/to take a hammering
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
